headline: ODOT Plans for Winter Storm
author: Nichole Hannahs
sentences: Ohio Governor Mike DeWine said he’s urging Ohioans to avoid unnecessary trips during the storm to give road crews room to work.
He said that those that do have to be out should be safe and take it slow, giving plenty of time to reach your destination.
The Ohio Department of Transporation is preparing for what could be a major winter storm taking aim on the state.
Officials said freezing rain is the most challenging because crews can’t pre-treat roads ahead of the storm.
ODOT is responsible for more than 43,000 lane miles of state and US routes and all interstates.
In our area ODOT crews expect freezing rain to be the biggest threat.
Once roads are treated, rain continuously washes the material away.
The said drivers can find updated travel information at ohgo.com
